alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 05 at 5:58PM EDT until July 05 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ANNE ARUNDEL COUNTY... At 558 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Rhode River, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...For those in the direct path of a tornado touchdown, flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Damage to roofs, siding, and windows may occur. Mobile homes may be damaged or destroyed. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Anne Arundel County, including the following locations... Galesville, West River, Riva and Edgewater. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
